summary: The Retirement Freedom Act (S. 2810) allows individuals eligible for Medicare Part A benefits to opt out.  The bill specifies how individuals can make this election, and subsequently re-enroll without penalty. It clarifies that opting out of Medicare does not require opting out of Social Security benefits, and that beneficiaries are not required to repay any previously paid Medicare Part A funds.  The bill was introduced by Senators Cruz and Lee.
